metadata.Title: CVE-2022-38178 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: By spoofing the target resolver with responses that have a malformed EdDSA signature, an attacker can trigger a small memory leak. It is possible to gradually erode available memory to the point where named crashes for lack of resources.

notes.Note: alexmurray> As of isc-dhcp-4.4.3-1, isc-dhcp vendors bind9 libs leosilva> versions affected: 9.9.12 - 9.9.13, 9.10.7 - 9.10.8, 9.18.0 - 9.18.6, 9.19.0 - 9.19.4.

criterions.comment: bind9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
